_header: All under sun is with swink here I-won
Note: See 1714, of which this may be a part.
_description: Worldly wealth makes trouble — three long lines with leonine rhyme; or three couplets

CamCCC405.Transcription:
Al vnder sunne catel is wyt swynk her y vounneAy kept wyt drede so
                    ful nap þat ye ne schodeAnd left vit sourwe van deȝ comyt after
                    amorwe
CamCCC405.Editions:
Person,  Henry Axel. 
             Cambridge Middle English Lyrics.
         Seattle: University of Washington Press, 1953; rev. ed. 1962: 71.
